summary: This document is an FBI evidence inventory list (FD-395) for case 72-MM-113327, detailing items seized or collected during the investigation. The items include original interview notes, consent forms, subpoena results, correspondence, monitored phone calls, identification documents, address books, deposition recordings, financial records, phone records, Bureau of Prisons records, and contact information for Epstein's associates and employees.

persons.name: Berry Kessler
persons.context: Appears as the subject of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) records and inmate records that were collected as evidence in the case.

events.title: Deposition Recording
events.description: A deposition was recorded on four DVDs in August 2009.

events.title: Interrogation Recording
events.description: An interrogation was recorded on November 6, 2009.

events.title: Interview Notes
events.description: Original notes were taken regarding an interview conducted on November 16, 2010.

keyFacts: The evidence inventory includes contact information for Jeffrey Epstein's associates and employees, written out by an assistant.
The inventory lists monitored phone calls, stored on seven discs, indicating electronic surveillance was part of the investigation.

Two passports, a Florida driver's license, a resident alien card, and a social security card were among the seized identification documents, suggesting the investigation involved tracking an individual's identity and movements.
